titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Michael C. Rockefeller collection FA256
titlestmt.author: Amy R. Fitch

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-06-01 00:11:04 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a selection of papers and photographs from Michael C. Rockefeller, the youngest son of Nelson A. Rockefeller and Mary Clark Rockefeller, including materials from his two anthropological expeditions on behalf of Harvard Univsersity to the Asmat region of New Guinea in 1961.

In addition to correspondence between Michael and his father, the collection contains Michael's journals, field notes, sketches, reference materials, drafts of his thesis "Nelson W. Aldrich and Banking Reform," and photographs. There are also some files related to the search for Michael, following his accidental death during his second expedition in New Guinea in November 1961. However, the bulk of the records are expressions of condolences to Nelson A. Rockefeller from the general public.
The papers also include documentation of Michael C. Rockefeller's posthumously published book "The Asmat of New Guinea" (1967).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Open for research. Permission is required prior to use or publication of any photographic images or archival materials from the Michael C. Rockefeller collection. Please see an RAC archivist for details.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of the RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder is empty. It originally contained two reference publications that were badly damaged by water and mold: Three Regions of Primitive Art and Film and Its Techniques. The copies were disposed of in 2011 because they or similar information were available online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs taken by and of Nelson A. Rockefeller's son Michael on his two expeditions to the Asmat region of New Guinea in 1961. There are no images of Nelson A. Rockefeller or the later search for Michael.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Background material on the area, acquired by Michael Rockefeller as a reference source for his travels in New Guinea.
